Package com.mackenziehigh.snowflake

Class GrammarBuilder

java.lang.Object
com.mackenziehigh.snowflake.GrammarBuilder
All Implemented Interfaces:
IGrammarBuilder
public final class GrammarBuilder extends Object implements IGrammarBuilder
This class provides a concrete grammar builder that can build grammars for immediate usage.
Author:
Mackenzie High

    • setRoot

      public IGrammarBuilder setRoot(String name)
      This method specifies the name of the root rule in the grammar.
      Specified by:
      setRoot in interface IGrammarBuilder
      Parameters:
      name - is the name of the root rule.
      Returns:
      this.

    • setTraceCount

      public IGrammarBuilder setTraceCount(int count)
      This method specifies the number of match starts/successes/failures to record.

      Higher counts may make debugging grammars easier, but more memory will be used.

      If this method is not invoked, then a default value of (1024) will be used.

      Specified by:
      setTraceCount in interface IGrammarBuilder
      Parameters:
      count - is the new maximum size of the backtrace.
      Returns:
      this.

      Specified by:

      Parameters:
      name - is the name of the new rule.
      item - the the rule that the new rule will attempt to match.

      Parameters:

      base - is the base-case of the recursive sequence.

    • repeat

      public IGrammarBuilder repeat(String name, String item, int minimum, int maximum)
      This method adds a new repetition-rule to the grammar that is being built.
      Specified by:
      repeat in interface IGrammarBuilder
      Parameters:
      name - is the name of the new rule.
      item - is the name of the rule that will be repeated.
      minimum - is the minimum number of times that the item must match.
      maximum - is the maximum number of times that the item will be matched.
      Returns:
      this.

    • star

      public IGrammarBuilder star(String name, String item)
      This method adds a "Zero or More" repetition-rule to the grammar that is being built.

      Equivalence: repeat(name, item, 0, Integer.MAX_VALUE)

      Specified by:
      star in interface IGrammarBuilder
      Parameters:
      name - is the name of the new rule.
      item - is the name of the rule that may be repeated.
      Returns:
      this.

    • plus

      public IGrammarBuilder plus(String name, String item)
      This method adds a "One or More" repetition-rule to the grammar that is being built.

      Equivalence: repeat(name, item, 1, Integer.MAX_VALUE)

      Specified by:
      plus in interface IGrammarBuilder
      Parameters:
      name - is the name of the new rule.

      public IGrammarBuilder option(String name, String item)

      Specified by:
      option in interface IGrammarBuilder

    • exclude

      public IGrammarBuilder exclude(String name, String include, String exclude)
      This method adds a single-char character-class to the grammar that is being built.
      Specified by:
      exclude in interface IGrammarBuilder
      Parameters:
      name - is the name of the new character-class.
      include - is the name of the character-class that is a superset of the new class.
      exclude - is the name of the character-class that is the complement of the new class.
      Returns:
      this.

      Specified by:

      Returns:

    • build

      public Grammar build()
      This method performs the actual construction of the new grammar and returns the result.

      Each invocation of this method returns a new object.

      Returns:
      the completed grammar.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the grammar cannot be built.
